pros: Networking High-tech methods Good animal facility
cons: Doesn't have PhD Low income Not have rule for all labs

pros: Paid Vacation and Sick Days
cons: Not a great work life balance.

review_title: Best culture you will ever find
job_title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) in Boston, MA
pros:
-Incredible employee and customer-centric culture. They absolutely love their product and everyone is on board to deliver the best product for customers.
- Great pay and the best benefits you can find in a company.
cons: Growing in the company really depends on the market and if they're hiring. You could get promoted within 6 months if you're doing well, or you could wait a lot longer if they're just not expanding their headcount.

pros: World-renowned science, collaborative environment, great mission
cons: Not much room for advancement

pros: can support EB1B green card
cons: but need to work for more than 3 years

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Great resources and there is a protocol for everything
cons: People can be very particular and sometimes rude when it comes to shared space and resources

review_title: Scientific research in a good laboratory
pros: Good laboratory equipment, professional administration stuff
cons: bureaucracy, which slows down the rate of the research process

review_title: Great place to network, train, and learn
pros: supportive, lots of resources, lots of connections, very inviting,
cons: despite lots of networking and experience to go around, not many paid opportunities to grow into

pros: collaborative environment, convenient facilities, share research source with Upenn
cons: life expenses are getting high near University city.

pros: easy going interesting people and very diverse
cons: lack of communication leader ship could use improvement

review_title: Wistar is a great place to work
pros:
Really amazing research
Nice people
Great events
Friendly administrators
cons: I don't have any specific cons. If you're interested in research that they are doing, nothing about the institute should stop you from joining.

pros: Great environment, very competitive training
cons: Work-life balance could be a con for some

pros: Friendly environment, wide field of research experience
cons: Not easy to move up

job_title: Research Financial Administrator in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Colleagues are friendly and helpful.
cons: I can’t think of one.

review_title: Amazing people doing important things, limited by ineffective management.
pros:
Great location, respectable facilities, great benefits (PENSION!). Decent funding.
Many people really want to do great and important things.
cons:
The success of an individual employee is not necessarily linked to the success of his manager, which destroys morale, thus it's incredibly difficult to move up in the Institute. This is typical of many academic organizations of this size.
Politics come into play way more often than they should. 
Many people stay employed despite repeated gross incompetence, which destroys morale. 
Upper management doesn't have a clear vision for where the Institute should be going, or if they had a real vision, they didn't share it with the rank and file.
Too little control over the operations of the individual labs.

review_title: The lab makes or breaks it
job_title: Research Assistant III in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Good health benefits, fairly good PTO, ability to collaborate with CHOP and UPENN is a plus.
cons: Experience is largely dependent on the lab you’re hired into. It’s very academic, and therefore the ability to switch managers is impossible. Plus, even if you did, you’d be stuck seeing your old boss on most likely a daily basis. Very poor management with certain PIs. Bonuses extremely low and doesn’t happen every year

pros:
The labs were very modern and definitely well-funded. I thought the culture was pretty relaxed, but I know that isn't necessarily the case with all the labs. You can see the P.I being too busy with important conferences and other Penn things as a Pro with the freedom or as a Con with the sometimes lack of guidance, but my Ph. D. candidate mentor was awesome.
Freedom in some labs.
cons: P.I's often too busy to be communicative as I mentioned previously. I wish my pay was a bit higher.

pros: There are quite a few very knowledgable scientists around. Good seminars and communications with people from wistar or upenn. Whatever you are working on, there always people you can discuss good science in general.
cons: The direction of the institute has problem. Outstanding program ( gene regulation ) is totally gone. Most of good PIs went to upenn or some where else. The support for basic science becomes much worse than before. Everything depends on translational research and who knows where it goes. upper level of management is bad. The reputation of this institute is going down.

pros: This is a great place to work, however, it is a non-profit, so you must take that into consideration. But the knowledge I gained there is second to none.
cons: Its a non-profit. Since there are many post-doctoral fellows working there, there is a tendency for some labs to work odd hours.

job_title: Non-Scientific Support Position in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
Interesting non-profit organization that is doing good work.
Academic environment without the large bureaucracy of a large university (on UPenn's campus).
Great co-workers.
cons:
Non-scientific staff are considered 2nd class. 
Different rules for scientists and everyone else. 
Very political atmosphere. Decisions are based on who you know, their status in the building, and who they are related to.
Management not very forward thinking.

pros: Congenial atmosphere, lots of useful seminars, and genuinely helpful primary investigators. Several very useful core facilities to aid your research.
cons: A bit too much power in the hands of the administrators and pencil-pushers for my taste. Constant fund-raising activities going on that may sometimes affect your schedule.

review_title: The research assistant  is a laboratory technician, who performs routine lab experiments and tests.
job_title: Research Assistant II in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Good place to learn! Friendly co-workers! Lots of lectures on new topics presented by world famous scientists. The place is great for post-docs!
cons: No opportunity to grow if you don't have a PhD degree. Job insecurity because of insufficient funding. Work is sometimes demanding and required extra hours, which are unpaid.

job_title: Post Doctoral Associate in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Smaller tight knit family of researchers with access to almost everything UPenn has to offer.
cons: Same cons as being a post-doc at any institution. Lousy pay, crazy hours, difficult to start a family in this line of work. Your experience probably depends more on your mentor than the institution.

review_title: More grunt work than actual research
pros: Great people, very easy to make friends with everyone. Fairly up to date lab equipment. Very laid-back atmosphere. Very flexible hours
cons:
Basically doing grunt work (PCR, Gel, blotting, ect)
Limited opportunity to actually conduct actual research. Students are often treated as disposable assistants.

review_title: Most of your experience depends on your mentor. Only if you get a good one, it will be a great experience.
pros: Great learning experience, good infrastructure.
cons: No raise in salary in 3 years, not even a penny.

job_title: Research Assistant II in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Good health insurance options, common use equipment and core facilities are great resources, lots of opportunities to meet other scientists
cons: If you have a problem with your current lab, it does not seem feasible to move to another lab easily as the PI you work with pays your salary.

review_title: Pay attention to lab size and if they want someone for the long run= bad signs
pros:
Close to Public Transportation
Health savings account
Agreement with Septa to use pre taxed dollars for passes 
Interesting research
Co workers are friendly
cons:
My PI is very aggressive and hostile. 
Low pay

review_title: Excellent work enviornment and oppurtunities to collaborate and learn
pros: good work and personal life balance, oppurtunities to coolaborate, learn new thinghs and expand your expertise
cons: no retirement benefits for postdoctoral fellows unless you work for 5 years, otherwise an excellent place to work and gain experience

job_title: Research Assistant I in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Friendly atmosphere, good benefits,  people in general seem happy and content.  Good learning environment. Very collaborative compared to other academia environment.
cons: Not much advancement opportunity for technician.

review_title: Not worth it- look for an industry job
pros: Good research, turning over millions
cons: Minor decisions held on hold till the top people decide. Refusal to include people who work on a project in the paper.

pros: great history and science; great benefits and decent compensation
cons: very political; very heavy on administration side; HR department does not care about employees

pros: People are very smart, energetic. The institute is mature and still growing healthy
cons: A lot of people are scientists, social event is not as much

pros: Team Atmosphere, Well Organized, Safety is a priority with this company
cons: Lack of position diversity for those looking to do something outside of research or administrative work.

pros: Wistar offers great benefits and has a start-of-the-art laboratories for postdoctoral fellows. Great funding/grant opportunities.
cons: Like most institutions, funding is based on NIH guidelines for Postdoctoral fellows.

pros: Great Benefits. Close to Wharton and access to U penn facilities.
cons: Too much politics between faculty and board of director. Constantly firing and hiring.

job_title: Wistar Research Assistant in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Great company culture and in house collaborations
cons: Salaries are competitive within the academic field, but not with industry.

job_title: Ph D Student/Research Assistant in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Diverse group of scientists with great scientific atmosphere
cons: Long working hours including weekend work at times

pros: Super friendly work environment! Great place to work.
cons: nothing, I really enjoyed my time here

pros: excellent scientists and core support
cons: highly political influences can be a problem

pros: Great infrastructure and connection including nearby UPenn
cons: Because of location, parking is problem.

job_title: Associate Staff Scientist in Phila, PA
pros: strong background, dedicated, excellent presentation and communication skills
cons: sometimes a little bit too critical

job_title: Senior Accounts Payable Associate in Erial, NJ
pros: some people are  nice
cons: too much upper management people

pros:
Decent (though diminishing) benefits. 
Great, dedicated researchers.
cons:
Desperately top-heavy
"Process-based" leadership that conveniently ignores established processes
No cohesive culture. As old ways are stamped out nothing is left in their place.

pros: Good people good research
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: A non-profit organization with poor management.
pros: They offer an excellent benefits package
cons: There is no ability for growth

cons: Doesn't have PhD Low income Not have rule for all labs
